name: Mixed Bag 21 Quiz / Test | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [D] | 10 Questions

questions.text: According to the Bible, Jonah gave Nineveh how many days to repent?
questions.explanation:
40.

	He was commanded by God to 'go to Nineveh, that great city, and cry against {it;for} their wickedness has come up before me'.

questions.text: Flip Wilson had a character named Geraldine. What was her boyfriend's name?
questions.explanation:
Killer.

	Flip also played the characters of Reverend Leroy, Danny Dancer and Herbie the ice cream man.

questions.text: Who hosted the weekly TV show 'Life Is Worth Living'?
questions.explanation:
Bishop Fulton Sheen.

	It was a prime time religious talk program that ran from 1952-1957.

questions.text: What was the name of Samantha's son on the TV series 'Bewitched'?
questions.explanation:
Adam.

	Adam came into the program on October 16, 1969 but was not seen regularly until the 1971-72 season.

questions.text: In what year was the Colt revolver invented?
questions.explanation:
1835.

	Invented in 1835, patented in 1836 it was the most popular pistol in the mid 19th century.

questions.text: On TV's 'Peter Gunn' what was the name of the bar that he used as a hangout?
questions.explanation:
Mothers.

	Mothers was a jazz nightclub. Peter Gunn was played by Craig Stevens.

questions.text: Which state was the first to legalize a state lottery?
questions.explanation:
New Hampshire.

	Lotteries in general are of an ancient origin. They date back to the Roman Empire.

questions.text: How many wickets are used in United States Croquet Association Tournaments?
questions.explanation:
6.

	All official tournament croquet variations use 6 wickets.

questions.text: What color was actress Marie Dressler's hair?
Salomey is the pig of which comic strip character?
questions.explanation:
Li'l Abner.

	Al Capp the creator began drawing in 1932 with the comic strip 'Colonel Gilfeather' and later worked for Ham Fisher on the comic strip 'Joe Palooka'.
